channel.title: Guess the picture?
channel.description:
Ok so i love quessing games, however i really have no idea on how to go about making one in either
html js php etc
I would love if someone can help out, basically it would display a pic and you quess the word, if you guess it then you go to another one :)

item.title: Guess the picture?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

So, do you want me to type up 30 pages of content or something? Look around man. First you’re going to have to learn basic HTML. Then you’re going to have to learn basics of whatever web development language you’d be interested in (ruby, php, etc.). Then you’ll have to learn how to interact with a database, which is usually covered in learning any server-sided web language.

Read full topic

item.title: Guess the picture?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Seriously what’s up with the Q, sorry but this is annoying me

Read full topic

item.title: Guess the picture?
item.dc:creator: @JoshuaCoombs JoshuaCoombs
item.description:
@JoshuaCoombs wrote:

Yes i am new, therefor im trying to get the bases of it where it would display a picture and if the correct word is enter it would pop up and say correct, then display another one, once i learn how to do this ill add to it like Level system, Coins etc

Read full topic

item.title: Guess the picture?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It’s a G and not a Q, amirite?

And pretty much you’d store all of your words and their corresponding images (probably just the link or file name) in a database. Retrieve them at random. When the user submits their answer, compare it to the data in the database, return RIGHT/WRONG. Track scores and already guessed words, etc.

This would be one of the more simple applications if you’re trying to learn a language.

Read full topic
